Have overlooked this title until we ran out of Co-op games yesterday. Oh man, why didnt we try this game sooner. Its funny, innovative and still looks and sounds great! We had alot of laughs and still got to use our brains until it hurt. 

We had bit of delay using the built in voice communication, so we switched to Skype. Thats the only negative.

Pros:
-Good storyline
-Shocking plot twists
-Comes with a puzzle maker
-Also comes with assorted trailers as well as all four Aperture Investment Opportunity videos (featuring the voice of JK Simmons)
-(Apparently) twice as long as the original
-More characters

Cons:
-Some tests are quite hard
-Recently, the puzzle maker has started crashing the game if you try to create your own puzzles or view your existing ones.

This was a great game, some of the puzzles may have been unclear, and that's why the single player initially took me a full 20 hours to complete, that and real world distractions. I have since made 2 community maps, played over 15 of them, and replayed it over 20 times!  I have also went through and saved at what I think are the most iconic points in the game, including the part where he kills you, and the part where you and Wheatley take on GLaDOS, as well as when you escape her, now I can take more cinematic playthroughs of short portions.  My first playthrough I didn't see the graphical evolution from Portal 1, on my analytical playthrough I definetley saw the improvement, there were a lot of minor graphic improvements, and what really sold we was the evolution of the cores.  In the original Portal the cores were spheres with unmoving handles and an eyeball on an axis, in this the cores have way more personality and expression, and when I did my playthrough with the developer commentary, they explained how they made the expressive character of Wheatley a possibility.  That's when I noticed the evolution of the cores graphics.  The addition of many new puzzle solving tools was great, while I was dissapointed at the removal of the high energy pellets, it was quickly made up for by the addition of tractor beams, lazers, light bridges, and the three gels, conversion, propulsion, gravity. Portal 2 is in every way a worthy sequel to the original game, on my first playthrough I hated the puzzles so much that I saw no improvement, not I see how great of a game this truly is, after multiple speed and cinematic runs.  This game is definetley worth the high price, but do yourself a favor and also buy the original and play it through.

å³ä½¿è¿™ä¸ªæ¸¸æˆä¸æ˜¯è€æ¸¸æˆè€Œæ˜¯å‡ºåœ¨2017å¹´ä¹Ÿæ˜¯åŠæ‰“ä¸€å¤§æ‰¹æ‰€è°“çš„3A
10/10
MÃœKEMMEL

Note: This game technically is possible to play it without the need to play the prequel since the first levels are easy enough to let you understand the mechanics but I don't recommend it because of the story. The first Portal game is just 1 hour long (yes, it's super short to be true) so buy the bundle one to not miss anything (and is super cheap both games when is at discount).

---------------

One of the most anticipated sequels back then in 2011! It comes with the same simple but efective portal mechanic from its prequel with very nice tweaks and additions like the introduction of gels. Thankfully the single campaign has more content in comparison of the 1-hour long prequel, taking more of 12 hours long! So the game is even worth buy it at full price!

The dialogs & the posters are very hilarious and clever dialogs during the course of all the game (enough proof that during the first day I had almost 20 screenshots in my computer that gave me little lazyness to upload all of them to my Steam profile). More importantly they add crucial clues about the laboratory's background and about the personnel back then (there is a comic named "Lab Rat" included in the game, I recommend you to read after playing the prequel).

The best thing of the game for me is without doubt the co-op courses, unlike the single mode puzzles, they are hard and gives an awesome satisfaction completing them (even my brother and me end hugging like the bots after completing the levels). Storywise the co-op mode is after the events of the single mode but is nothing related so you can freely first start the co-op without get spoiled!  Also the online connection between both players is AWESOME! Unlike most of the online game, here there is not a single lag moment during the levels (there sometime little slowdown during the load times but you know, is better that than DURING your game solving).

Last but no least, there is the community maps so with enough storage there is enough content to keep playing!
Un chef d'oeuvre !
this is the greatest game ever madeï»¿
Love it!

Here lies a great sequel... More characters, better story, more of the great gameplay, and more crazy levels. Again the scripting is probably the best I have heard in any game... The underlying themes become more clear in this game, truly building upon and soaring above the first Portal. And again the credits are really funny. Buy this if you have played and enjoyed the first Portal, or even if you enjoy any puzzle or story games. I review nearly every game that comes out (not on Steam) and I would give Game of the Year 2011 to this masterpeice. Well done Valve. 10/10... In fact this game is so good I think I missed my own funeral...
It's really fun and challenging  I've been playing for a long time
nice puzzles

ä¸å¾—ä¸è¯´ï¼Œæ¸¸æˆçš„å¯ç©æ€§ç‰¹åˆ«é«˜ï¼Œå†é…åˆä¸Šæ— æ•Œçš„å‰§æƒ…ï¼Œç®€ç›´ç§°å¾—ä¸Šç¥ä½œï¼Œæœ¬æ¥æƒ³è¯´æ‰“å®Œè¿™ä¸€å…³å°±ç»“æŸçš„ï¼Œå¯æˆ‘æ§åˆ¶ä¸ä½æˆ‘åˆ¶å‡ ï¼Œè€æ˜¯æƒ³ä¸€ç›´ç©ä¸‹å»ï¼Œ[spoiler]è¿˜æœ‰ï¼Œå‰§æƒ…çœŸæ˜¯ä¸€æ³¢ä¸‰æŠ˜ï¼Œä¹‹å‰è¿˜æƒ³æ€Då§å…¨å®¶çš„ï¼Œçªç„¶è¢«æ´—ç™½çš„ï¼Œåˆæœ‰ç‚¹å¿ƒç–¼å¥¹äº†[/spoiler]   å¾ˆæƒ³Vç¤¾èƒ½å‡º3ï¼Œä¸è¿‡æˆ‘ä¼°è®¡æ˜¯ä¸å¯èƒ½äº†
LINDO

Portal 2 is a puzzle/adventure game and the sequel to Portal. Now I would say that if you like puzzles you need this game, but even if you don't like puzzles you need this game. The story that you will become absorbed in will be enough to keep your interest and the puzzles are not too difficult to solve - the game builds up your technique by starting off very basic and the unique and fun portal mechanics will keep you persevering. The puzzles get harder towards the end though and if you want something even more challenging then some of the community created maps will test you.


+ The portal mechanics are an exciting new way to solve puzzles.
+ Immersive adventure.
+ Great story.
+ Superb voice acting and witty dialogue.
+ Awesome music.
+ Has a co-op adventure.
+ Has community maps (you can create and publish your own maps for others to play and you can also play other people's maps, single player and co-op maps, providing a lot of extra content).

- It was long, but it's so good that I wish it was longer. Portal 3 please Valve?
Jeu gÃ©nial !!!! Si vous chercher un jeu de puzzle, avec une histoire Ã©mouvante et poignante, ne cherchez pas ce jeu est fait pour vous !!!

Amazing game. I can't belive it was sitting idle in my library for like 3 years. Finally I completed it last night in around 6-7 hours run (single player). I need to try co-op now ^_^

PROS:
-Very simple mechanics with incredibly smart level and puzzle design
-Probably the best use of humor in any game I've played
-Well written script and top notch voice acting
-Puzzles are set just right, not too hard to stale the progress, not too easy to fail to provide a challenge
-POTATO CORE TRANSFER(!)
-Last boss fight and Ending

CONS:
-Maybe a little on the short side
-It had to end

Final Verdict 9/10

This game, where do I start? It has a story that is good no matter how many times you play the game, and can be quite strange at times. There is always an achievment to work for, or a secret room to find. You can play with friends, and multiplayer is in itself a story, which can be hilarious and maybe challenge your friendship... I recommend this game to anyone who likes puzzlers, or just goofing around with quantum space holes.
